articles.headline: A Pension Fund Invests Against the Rules, and Wins
articles.snippet: While some call its strategy crazy, the Tampa firefighters and police officers pension fund has benefited from ignoring widely embraced investment doctrine.
articles.abstract: While some call its strategy crazy, the Tampa firefighters and police officers pension fund has benefited from ignoring widely embraced investment doctrine.
articles.lead_paragraph: Are the trustees of the Tampa firefighters and police officers pension fund out of their minds?

articles.headline: Russia’s Shifting of Border Force Stirs U.S. Worry
articles.snippet: The national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, expressed skepticism that troop movements on the border of southern and eastern Ukraine were merely training exercises.
articles.abstract: The national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, expressed skepticism that troop movements on the border of southern and eastern Ukraine were merely training exercises.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House cast doubt Friday on the Kremlin’s claims that thousands of troops massing on the border of southeastern Ukraine are merely involved in training exercises, deepening fears that Russian aggression will not end in Crimea.

articles.headline: Unwilling to Allow His Wife a Divorce, He Marries Another
articles.snippet: Protesters hope to free a woman “chained” under Orthodox Jewish law to a husband, even after a civil divorce and his remarriage.
articles.abstract: Protesters hope to free a woman “chained” under Orthodox Jewish law to a husband, even after a civil divorce and his remarriage.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — The wedding was a modest affair, held in a reception hall overlooking an artificial lake tucked behind a suburban strip. But just minutes after it ended, the bride and groom hurriedly scurried past dozens of protesters here who were chanting “Bigamist!” and “Shame on you!”

articles.headline: Coping When Not Entering Retirement Together
articles.snippet: Couples nearing retirement must discuss not only whether they have enough, but what will happen when routines are different and less money flows in.
articles.abstract: Couples nearing retirement must discuss not only whether they have enough, but what will happen when routines are different and less money flows in.
articles.lead_paragraph: FOR Daniel Ryan, turning 40 and 50 came and went. But sometime around his 61st birthday last July, he said he had an “old man crisis.”

articles.headline: Lawmakers Attack Cost of New Hepatitis Drug
articles.snippet: The congressmen’s inquiry about the $84,000 price for a 12-week course of treatment spurred a sell-off in biotechnology stocks on Friday.
articles.abstract: The congressmen’s inquiry about the $84,000 price for a 12-week course of treatment spurred a sell-off in biotechnology stocks on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new drug to treat hepatitis C that costs $1,000 a pill has caused rising concern among insurers and state Medicaid programs. It has now also spurred interest from Democratic congressmen whose queries about the drug prompted a sell-off in biotechnology stocks on Friday.

articles.headline: As Sanctions Start, Russia Feels a Sting
articles.snippet: With the onset of sanctions, Russia’s stock indexes opened sharply lower and agencies threatened to cut the country’s creditworthiness, but President Vladimir V. Putin’s oligarchs stood by him.
articles.abstract: With the onset of sanctions, Russia’s stock indexes opened sharply lower and agencies threatened to cut the country’s creditworthiness, but President Vladimir V. Putin’s oligarchs stood by him.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — American and European sanctions rattled Russia’s economy on Friday, with Moscow’s stock indexes opening sharply lower, rating agencies threatening to reduce the country’s creditworthiness, and hints of trepidation coming from Russia’s tycoons as they concluded an annual conference here.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Neil MacFarquhar

articles.headline: G.M.’s Bankruptcy Drawn Into Defect Inquiry
articles.snippet: Federal authorities are investigating whether the company failed to disclose in its landmark bankruptcy filing the defects that have now led to the recall of 1.6 million cars.
articles.abstract: Federal authorities are investigating whether the company failed to disclose in its landmark bankruptcy filing the defects that have now led to the recall of 1.6 million cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities’ nascent investigation into General Motors is looking in part into whether the automaker committed bankruptcy fraud by not disclosing defects that could lead to expensive future liabilities, a person briefed on the inquiry said on Friday.
articles.byline: By Danielle Ivory and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: The Stone Unturned: Credit Ratings
articles.snippet: As its proposed rules languish, some investor advocates want the Securities and Exchange Commission to start over — and to get tougher.
articles.abstract: As its proposed rules languish, some investor advocates want the Securities and Exchange Commission to start over — and to get tougher.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s the one question about the 2008 financial crisis that people still ask me more than any other: Why have regulators done so little to rein in the credit rating agencies? Other institutions that contributed to the mortgage debacle have submitted to new rules and compliance requirements, but Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s and their peers remained relatively untouched.

articles.headline: Not the Best Way to Sell a Smartphone
articles.snippet: In a brutal global business, marketing missteps inflict much pain. Just ask HTC.
articles.abstract: In a brutal global business, marketing missteps inflict much pain. Just ask HTC.
articles.lead_paragraph: As HTC readied a new version of its flagship smartphone, it planned for many challenges. It didn’t know that one of them would be Roshan Jamkatel, a teenager from Schaumburg, Ill.

articles.headline: Au Revoir, Entrepreneurs
articles.snippet: Saying their own country stifles new business, French innovators are finding opportunity elsewhere — especially in London.
articles.abstract: Saying their own country stifles new business, French innovators are finding opportunity elsewhere — especially in London.
articles.lead_paragraph: Guillaume Santacruz, an aspiring French entrepreneur, brushed the rain from his black sweater and skinny jeans and headed down to a cavernous basement inside Campus London, a seven-story hive run by Google in the city’s East End.

articles.headline: N.S.A. Breached Chinese Servers Seen as Security Threat
articles.snippet: As the United States made a public case about the dangers of buying from Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications giant, classified documents show that the National Security Agency was creating its own back doors — directly into Huawei’s networks.
articles.abstract: As the United States made a public case about the dangers of buying from Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications giant, classified documents show that the National Security Agency was creating its own back doors — directly into Huawei’s networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American officials have long considered Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications giant, a security threat, blocking it from business deals in the United States for fear that the company would create “back doors” in its equipment that could allow the Chinese military or Beijing-backed hackers to steal corporate and government secrets.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: Garden Buys Stake in Indie Film Bastion
articles.snippet: A deal will bring together an independent film company and a deep-pocketed sports and live entertainment brand looking to expand.
articles.abstract: A deal will bring together an independent film company and a deep-pocketed sports and live entertainment brand looking to expand.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Tribeca Enterprises, the Manhattan-based independent film concern co-founded by Robert De Niro, has agreed to sell a 50 percent stake to the Madison Square Garden Company in a deal that values Tribeca at $45 million.

articles.headline: Paul Has Ideas, but His Backers Want 2016 Plan
articles.snippet: Some Republicans note that Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, does not have a political or fund-raising infrastructure to match his emerging national profile. Mr. Paul has been working to change that.
articles.abstract: Some Republicans note that Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, does not have a political or fund-raising infrastructure to match his emerging national profile. Mr. Paul has been working to change that.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In a ballroom at the Olympic Club, a grand, early-20th-century building at the foot of Nob Hill, Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, pitched a gathering of venture capitalists last week in an effort to show them that he may be the next big thing.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Today’s Girls Love Pink Bows as Playthings, but These Shoot
articles.snippet: Inspired by a succession of female warrior heroes, toy makers are marketing a more aggressive line of playthings for girls — even as the industry clings to every shade of pink.
articles.abstract: Inspired by a succession of female warrior heroes, toy makers are marketing a more aggressive line of playthings for girls — even as the industry clings to every shade of pink.
articles.lead_paragraph: Once upon a time, Grace Maher twirled around the house in Disney princess costumes, a vision of sequins, tiaras and pink.
articles.byline: By Hilary Stout and Elizabeth A. Harris

articles.headline: A Routine Flight, Till Both Routine and Flight Vanish
articles.snippet: As the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines plane continues, experts and investigators have attempted to construct a portrait of Flight 370 with what is known.
articles.abstract: As the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines plane continues, experts and investigators have attempted to construct a portrait of Flight 370 with what is known.
articles.lead_paragraph: The night sky was clear above the clouds, and the last glimmer of a setting half-moon had faded when Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, cruising at 35,000 feet over the Gulf of Thailand, approached the border between Malaysian and Vietnamese airspace on its usual route to Beijing. What happened next should have been routine for a twice-daily milk run between two of Asia’s most important cities. Air traffic controllers outside Kuala Lumpur usually hand the jet off to their counterparts in Ho Chi Minh City as the flight turns northeast toward the Chinese capital.
articles.byline: By Philip P. Pan and Kirk Semple

articles.headline: The Catholic Roots of Obama’s Activism
articles.snippet: In an often-overlooked period of President Obama’s life, he had a small office in a South Side parish and became steeped in the social justice wing of the Catholic Church.
articles.abstract: In an often-overlooked period of President Obama’s life, he had a small office in a South Side parish and became steeped in the social justice wing of the Catholic Church.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — In a meeting room under Holy Name Cathedral, a rapt group of black Roman Catholics listened as Barack Obama, a 25-year-old community organizer, trained them to lobby their fellow delegates to a national congress in Washington on issues like empowering lay leaders and attracting more believers.

articles.headline: G.M. Uses Social Media to Manage Customers and Its Reputation
articles.snippet: To deal with car owners’ concerns after a long-delayed safety recall, General Motors is turning to forums like Twitter and Facebook.
articles.abstract: To deal with car owners’ concerns after a long-delayed safety recall, General Motors is turning to forums like Twitter and Facebook.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — If you glance at the Facebook page of General Motors, it seems like business as usual at the Detroit automaker, even though the company is struggling to cope with the recalls of 1.6 million cars that it has linked to 12 deaths.

articles.headline: 3 Presidents and a Riddle Named Putin
articles.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has argued with United States presidents, lectured them, misled them, accused them, kept them waiting, kept them guessing, betrayed them and felt betrayed by them.
articles.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has argued with United States presidents, lectured them, misled them, accused them, kept them waiting, kept them guessing, betrayed them and felt betrayed by them.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Bill Clinton found him to be cold and worrisome, but predicted he would be a tough and able leader. George W. Bush wanted to make him a friend and partner in the war on terror, but grew disillusioned over time.

articles.headline: Risks Abound as Reporters Play in Traffic
articles.snippet: The availability of ready metrics on content is not only changing the way news organizations compensate their employees, but will have a significant effect on the news itself.
articles.abstract: The availability of ready metrics on content is not only changing the way news organizations compensate their employees, but will have a significant effect on the news itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is a dirty secret of the journalism profession that many reporters are bad at math. Many of us ended up typing our way to a living because we had an easier time making words dance than numbers.

articles.headline: Japan to Let U.S. Assume Control of Nuclear Cache
articles.snippet: Japan will announce Monday that it will turn over to Washington more than 700 pounds of weapons-grade plutonium and a large quantity of highly enriched uranium.
articles.abstract: Japan will announce Monday that it will turn over to Washington more than 700 pounds of weapons-grade plutonium and a large quantity of highly enriched uranium.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — Japan will announce Monday that it will turn over to Washington more than 700 pounds of weapons-grade plutonium and a large quantity of highly enriched uranium, a decades-old research stockpile that is large enough to build dozens of nuclear weapons, according to American and Japanese officials.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Web Fiction, Serialized and Social
articles.snippet: With Wattpad, a storytelling app, the once-solitary writing process has become informal, intimate and highly interactive.
articles.abstract: With Wattpad, a storytelling app, the once-solitary writing process has become informal, intimate and highly interactive.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — Not since the heyday of Dickens, Dumas and Henry James has serialized fiction been this big.

articles.headline: Death Raises Questions About On-Set Safety
articles.snippet: An accident involving a camera assistant who was killed by a train has spurred inquiries about safety on the set, particularly on independent films.
articles.abstract: An accident involving a camera assistant who was killed by a train has spurred inquiries about safety on the set, particularly on independent films.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — It took seconds for a freight train to kill Sarah Jones, a 27-year-old camera assistant who died on the set of an independent film, “Midnight Rider,” in rural Georgia on Feb. 20.

articles.headline: Selling a Poison by the Barrel: Liquid Nicotine for E-Cigarettes
articles.snippet: “E-liquids” used to refill e-cigarettes are potent, unregulated neurotoxins. Evidence of the potential dangers is already emerging.
articles.abstract: “E-liquids” used to refill e-cigarettes are potent, unregulated neurotoxins. Evidence of the potential dangers is already emerging.
articles.lead_paragraph: A dangerous new form of a powerful stimulant is hitting markets nationwide, for sale by the vial, the gallon and even the barrel.

articles.headline: Jet Fell Into Ocean With All Lost, Premier Says
articles.snippet: Based on analysis of satellite data, Prime Minister Najib Razak of Malaysia said there was no longer any doubt that the plane flew south into remote waters and could not have landed safely.
articles.abstract: Based on analysis of satellite data, Prime Minister Najib Razak of Malaysia said there was no longer any doubt that the plane flew south into remote waters and could not have landed safely.
articles.lead_paragraph: PEARCE AIR FORCE BASE, Australia — A British satellite company has solved one crucial aspect of the mystery surrounding the Malaysia Airlines flight that disappeared on March 8, using a complex mathematical process to determine that it ended its journey in the middle of the southern Indian Ocean.
articles.byline: By Thomas Fuller and Chris Buckley

articles.headline: Russia Is Ousted From Group of 8 by U.S. and Allies
articles.snippet: The move was intended to condemn Russian actions in Crimea and will at least temporarily end Russia’s two-decade participation in the diplomatic forum.
articles.abstract: The move was intended to condemn Russian actions in Crimea and will at least temporarily end Russia’s two-decade participation in the diplomatic forum.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — The United States and its closest allies on Monday cast Russia out of the Group of 8 industrialized democracies, their most exclusive club, to punish President Vladimir V. Putin for his lightning annexation of Crimea, while threatening tougher sanctions if he escalates aggression against Ukraine.
articles.byline: By Alison Smale and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Hundreds of Egyptians Sentenced to Death in Killing of a Police Officer
articles.snippet: The conviction of 529 detainees accelerated the crackdown against Islamist supporters of Mohammed Morsi, the ousted president.
articles.abstract: The conviction of 529 detainees accelerated the crackdown against Islamist supporters of Mohammed Morsi, the ousted president.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINYA, Egypt — A crowd gathered outside a courthouse in the town of Matay erupted in wailing and rage on Monday when a judge sentenced 529 defendants to death in just the second session of their trial, convicting them of murdering a police officer in anger at the ouster of the Islamist president. Here in the provincial capital just a few miles away, schools shut down early, and many stayed indoors fearing a riot, residents said.
